section.name: Configuring a DataSource in SimpleJNDI
section.p:
When storing data in a database, you are going to need to setup a javax.sql.DataSource object in the simple-jndi configuration. Here's a brief example:
Place a file named ScrapingDS.properties next to your default.properties and containing the following content:
# your JDBC driver, must be in classpath driver=oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleDriver
# username for db user=sa
# password for that username password=lollipop
# jdbc url to connect with url=jdbc:oracle:thin:@yourdb.example.com:port:sid
# let simple-jndi know to make this an Object type=javax.sql.DataSource
# optional, turn on pooling. # Commons DBCP, Pool and Collections must be in the classpath #pool=true
Then in your default.properties, you can simply configure it with:
.... Xxx.store=Jdbc Xxx.DS=ScrapingDS ....
